page.title: 13FOXHOUNDS - PETWORTH RURAL
page.content: The local Hunt is the Chiddingfold, Leconfield and Cowdray Foxhounds. The Pony Club for those under eighteen, had an August camp at Midhurst which was almost washed away after a week of 1985's torrential rain. The Hunt has 120 subscribers and the Supporters Club a membership of 400. The Kennels are at Petworth Park. There is strong local opposition to hunting as a blood sport and objectors often try to disorganise a Meet by spraying riders, hounds and horses. By tradition the Boxing Day Meet is at the ruins, Midhurst, and the last for the season is held at Toby's Stone on Bignor Hill, erected in honour of Earl Fitzwilliam's son James, known as Toby, a dedicated foxhunter. Hunt servants wear the blue livery of Lord Egremont, Vice Chairman.
